Package ohos.eventhandler

Class EventRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.eventhandler.EventRunner

  • public final class EventRunner
extends Object
    Creates and manages the event queue in the current thread.

    After you call the run() method, the EventRunner will continuously retrieve events from the event queue and dispatch the events to the matching EventHandler. Then the EventHandler#processEvent(InnerEvent) method will be called to process the events.

    Since:
    1

    • Method Detail

      • current

        public static EventRunner current​()
        Obtains the EventRunner object bound to the current thread.
        Returns:
        Returns the EventRunner object bound to the current thread; returns null if no object is bound.
        Since:
        1

      • create

        public static EventRunner create​()
        Creates a thread and starts an EventRunner. The EventRunner is automatically managed by the system by default.
        Returns:
        Returns an EventRunner in the new thread.
        Since:
        1

      • create

        public static EventRunner create​(boolean inNewThread)
        Creates a thread and starts an EventRunner with the inNewThread parameter passed to specify who will manage the EventRunner.
        Parameters:
        inNewThread - Specifies whether the EventRunner will be automatically managed by the system. The value true indicates that it will be automatically managed by the system, and the value false indicates that it needs to be manually managed by yourself.
        Returns:
        Returns an EventRunner in the new thread.
        Since:
        1

      • create

        public static EventRunner create​(String newThreadName)
        Creates a thread with the given name and starts an EventRunner. The EventRunner is automatically managed by the system by default.
        Parameters:
        newThreadName - Indicates the name of the new thread. If this parameter is null or an empty string is passed, the default name is used.
        Returns:
        Returns an EventRunner in the new thread.
        Since:
        1

      • setLogger

        public void setLogger​(Logger logger)
        Sets the Logger object for logging messages that are processed by this EventRunner.
        Parameters:
        logger - Indicates the Logger object you have implemented for logging messages.
        Since:
        4

      • dump

        public void dump​(Dumper dumper)
        Prints out the internal information about an object in the specified format, helping you diagnose internal errors of the object.
        Parameters:
        dumper - Indicates the Dumper object you have implemented to process the output internal information.
        Since:
        4

      • getMainEventRunner

        public static EventRunner getMainEventRunner​()
        Obtains the EventRunner for the main thread of the application.

        The EventRunner for the main thread (also referred to as the UI thread) is generated by the system during application initialization.

        Returns:
        Returns the EventRunner for the main thread of the application.
        Since:
        2

      • getThreadId

        public long getThreadId​()
        Obtains the ID of the worker thread associated with this EventRunner.
        Returns:
        Returns the worker thread ID of this EventRunner.
        Since:
        3

      • isCurrentRunnerThread

        public boolean isCurrentRunnerThread​()
        Checks whether the current thread is the worker thread of this EventRunner.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the current thread is the worker thread of this EventRunner; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getEventQueue

        public EventQueue getEventQueue​()
        Obtains the event queue of this EventRunner.
        Returns:
        Returns the event queue of this EventRunner.
        Since:
        4

      • getCurrentEventQueue

        public static EventQueue getCurrentEventQueue​()
        Obtains the event queue of the EventRunner associated with the current thread.

        This static method can be called from anywhere.

        Returns:
        Returns the event queue of the EventRunner associated with the current thread.
        Since:
        4

      • run

        public boolean run​()
            throws IllegalStateException
        Starts an EventRunner that is not automatically managed by the system. System-managed EventRunner objects are automatically started by the system.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the EventRunner is started; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the EventRunner is automatically managed by the system.
        Since:
        1

      • stop

        public boolean stop​()
             throws IllegalStateException
        Stops an EventRunner that is not automatically managed by the system. System-managed EventRunner objects are automatically stopped by the system.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the EventRunner is stopped; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if the EventRunner is automatically managed by the system.
        Since:
        1
